[[WiMAX]]| revenue = | homepage = [http://www.adam.com.au/ www.adam.com.au] | industry = [[Telecommunications]] }} '''Adam Internet''' is an Australian [[Internet service provider]]. ==Background== Originally founded in 1986 as the Adelaide [[Amiga]] club, Adam Internet grew out of the original [[bulletin board system]] of the Adelaide Amiga User Group.{{cite web|last=LeMay|first=Renai|title=Friday Five: Adam Internetâs Scott Hicks|url=http://delimiter.com.au/2010/02/05/friday-five-adam-internets-scott-hicks/|work=Delimiter|accessdate=30 August 2010|date=5 February 2010}} The bulletin board was set up in 1987 and was originally run by the user group, but was co-opted by its [[sysop]], Greg Hicks. In 1989 it transformed into a commercial multi-line [[TBBS]]-based bulletin board, which, at the time, was the largest bulletin board system in the southern hemisphere, and for many years was the most popular in Adelaide. With 100 staff members,{{cite news |url=http://www.adam.com.au/nImages/clockingupthehours.pdf |title=Clocking up the hours. |publisher=The Advertiser, South Australia |last=Tredrea |first=Alexandra |date=2 January 2008}} and a customer base of 80,000+{{cite press |url=http://www.alvarion.com/images/stories/resourcecenter/customerstories/cs_adam%20australia_11_2009_lr.pdf |title=Adam Internet, Australia |publisher=Alvarion}} in 2009 Adam Internet held 35% of South Australia's Internet market. Adam Internet provides a range of separately metered services at no extra charge,http://www.adam.com.au/unmetered/unmetered.php some of these services being operated by Adam directly, examples including: a gaming community â GamingSA, which operates a range of servers for various games; ABC iView; and file servers â FileArena, which hosts a large file repository containing (but not limited to) games, Linux distributions, streaming of local youth radio station [[Fresh FM (Australia)|Fresh 92.7]], and a [[Tucows]] mirror. ==Milestones== *'''Adam Internet Launches AdamMAX, a [[WiMAX]] product:''' November 2009 In an Australian first, local provider Adam internet has secured a $3 million contract with the State Government to eliminate blackspots in the metropolitan area, with those currently unable to access broadband eligible to access the infrastructure for free â paying only the data fees which will start about $49 a month.{{cite news |url=http://www.news.com.au/adelaidenow/story/0,22606,25928142-5006301,00.html |title=Adam Internet to overcome blackspots for 55,000 users |publisher=AdelaideNOW, news.com.au |last=Stewart |first=Frances |date=14 August 2009}} ==References== {{Reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.adam.com.au Official website] *[http://www.gamingsa.com GamingSA Gaming Network] *[http://www.filearena.net FileArena] *[http://forums.whirlpool.net.au/forum-threads.cfm?f=109 Adam forum on Whirlpool] *[http://bc.whirlpool.net.au/bc-isp.cfm?id=35 Adam Internet listing on Broadband Choice] {{Internet service providers of Australia}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2010}} {{Use British English|date=November 2010}} [[Category:Internet service providers of Australia]]
